00:00:02:775000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:02:775000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:02:775000.Dialogue: Whatcha doin' there? Working on a new plan to catch the roadrunner?

00:00:05:984000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:05:984000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:05:984000.Dialogue: The humorous implication being that I am Wile E. Coyote?

00:00:11:422000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:11:422000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:14:075000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:14:075000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:14:075000.Dialogue: And this is a schematic for a bird-trapping device that will ultimately backfire and cause me physical injury?

00:00:20:615000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:20:615000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:27:755000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:27:755000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:27:755000.Dialogue: What I'm doing here is trying to determine when I'm going to die.

00:00:31:926000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:31:926000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:31:926000.Dialogue: A lot of people are working on that research. So what is all this?

00:00:38:216000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:38:216000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:38:216000.Dialogue: My family history factoring in longevity, propensity for disease, et cetera.

00:00:43:521000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:43:521000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:43:521000.Dialogue: Interesting. Cause of death for Uncle Carl was KBB. What's "KBB"?

00:00:47:809000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:47:809000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:51:146000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:51:146000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:52:881000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:00:52:881000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:52:881000.Dialogue: It was Thanksgiving. Uncle Carl said, "I think "there's a badger living in our chimney. Hand me that flashlight."

00:01:02:540000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:01:02:540000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:02:540000.Dialogue: Those were the last words he ever spoke to us.

00:01:05:743000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:01:05:743000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:05:743000.Dialogue: I don't think you need to worry about death by badgers being hereditary.

00:01:10:131000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:01:10:131000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:10:131000.Dialogue: Not true. The fight or flight instinct is coded genetically. Instead of fleeing, he chose to fight barehanded against a brawny member of the weasel family. Who's to say that I don't share that flawed DNA?

00:01:24:229000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:01:24:229000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:24:229000.Dialogue: You can always get a badger and find out.

00:01:30:652000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:01:30:652000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:30:652000.Dialogue: But seriously, even if I disregard the Uncle Carl factor, at best I have 60 years left.

00:01:37:525000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:01:37:525000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:40:128000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:01:40:128000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:40:128000.Dialogue: 60 only takes me to here. I need to get to here.

00:01:43:981000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:01:43:981000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:45:833000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:01:45:833000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:45:833000.Dialogue: The earliest estimate of the singularity, when man will be able to transfer his consciousness into machines and achieve immortality.

00:01:53:558000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:01:53:558000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:53:558000.Dialogue: So, you're upset about missing out on becoming some sort of freakish self-aware robot?

00:01:59:697000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:01:59:697000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:02:03:851000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:02:03:851000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:06:003000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:02:06:003000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:06:003000.Dialogue: You don't get it, Leonard. I'm going to miss so much-- the unified field theory, cold fusion, the dogapus.

00:02:15:897000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:02:15:897000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:17:515000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:02:17:515000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:17:515000.Dialogue: The hybrid dog and octopus. Man's underwater best friend.

00:02:24:789000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:02:24:789000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:26:241000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:02:26:241000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:26:241000.Dialogue: I was going to. I planned on giving it to myself on my 300th birthday.

00:02:31:195000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:02:31:195000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:31:195000.Dialogue: Wait a minute. You hate dogs.

00:02:33:248000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has a series of whiteboards across the room.
00:02:33:248000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:33:248000.Dialogue: A dogapus can play fetch with eight balls. No one can hate that.

00:03:04:936000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:04:936000.Dialogue: It came to $28.17. Let's say six bucks apiece.

00:03:18:583000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:18:583000.Dialogue: Oh, you wanted me to pay.

00:03:20:118000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:20:118000.Dialogue: It's no big deal. No, no, no, no. You're right.

00:03:28:760000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:28:760000.Dialogue: He said, "If he had woman parts, he'd eat for free the rest of his life""

00:03:34:666000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:34:666000.Dialogue: Yeah, but you wouldn't be able to talk to yourself.

00:03:40:105000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:40:105000.Dialogue: I'm a little low on cash.

00:03:44:576000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:44:576000.Dialogue: How can you walk around with no money?

00:03:47:762000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:47:762000.Dialogue: It's okay, you can owe me.

00:03:54:536000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:54:536000.Dialogue: But it's Thursday. Thursday's pizza night.

00:03:57:271000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:57:271000.Dialogue: Not for me. Thursday is now Cruciferous Vegetable Night. Tonight's selection: Brussels sprouts.

00:04:04:796000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:04:796000.Dialogue: Really? You're changing the Sheldonian calendar?

00:04:08:633000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:08:633000.Dialogue: It's a small price to pay.

00:04:14:289000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:14:289000.Dialogue: In order to live long enough to fuse my consciousness with cybernetics, I need to change my diet.

00:04:19:227000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:19:227000.Dialogue: Wait. Cybernetics is robot stuff, right?

00:04:22:463000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:22:463000.Dialogue: So you want to turn yourself into some sort of robot?

00:04:27:168000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:27:168000.Dialogue: Okay, here's my question. Didn't you already do that?

00:04:32:574000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:32:574000.Dialogue: Flattering, but sadly, no. I'm also planning to begin an exercise regimen designed to strengthen my cardiovascular system. AKA jogging.

00:04:43:001000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:43:001000.Dialogue: Wait. Honey, have you ever run before?

00:04:44:586000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:44:586000.Dialogue: Certainly. I've run from bullies, dogs, angry chickens... and one particularly persistent P.E. teacher determined to bend me over and give me a scoliosis test.

00:05:00:685000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:00:685000.Dialogue: You're right. Penny jogs. Maybe you guys can run together.

00:05:08:543000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:08:543000.Dialogue: Yeah, if we chat, it will create the illusion of time going faster.

00:05:15:066000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:15:066000.Dialogue: Um, how does he know I jog?

00:05:17:202000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:17:202000.Dialogue: Oh, he watches you from his car with high-powered binoculars.

00:05:21:522000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:21:522000.Dialogue: Oh, my God, that is so creepy!

00:05:28:413000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:28:413000.Dialogue: And he says he's not gonna stop.

00:05:33:635000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:33:635000.Dialogue: Then see a shrink and figure out how to talk to women.

00:05:48:433000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:48:433000.Dialogue: What the hell? What's the matter?

00:05:54:856000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:54:856000.Dialogue: I have pain radiating from my navel to my lower right abdomen. I'm nauseated and feverish. I believe I may have cholera.

00:06:04:699000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:04:699000.Dialogue: There's no cholera in Pasadena. Just like last summer, when there was no malaria in Pasadena.

00:06:10:121000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:10:121000.Dialogue: Well, if it's not cholera, then based on a quick Internet search, the other explanations in decreasing order of likelihood are Hirschsprung's Disease, botulism, a 30-foot tapeworm or accidental ingestion of chrysanthemum blossoms.

00:06:25:053000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:25:053000.Dialogue: When would you have accidentally eaten chrysanthemum blossoms?

00:06:28:857000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:28:857000.Dialogue: It's part of an unlikely scenario that involves sleepwalking and a 24-hour flower mart with a less-than- vigilant proprietor. Oh, Lord, my belly!

00:06:39:617000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:39:617000.Dialogue: I haven't. I've been meaning to, but who has the time?

00:06:43:321000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:43:321000.Dialogue: Let's get you to the hospital.

00:06:45:890000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:45:890000.Dialogue: So this is how it ends... with cruel irony. Just as I make the commitment to preserving my body, I am betrayed by my appendix, a vestigial organ. Do you know the original purpose of the appendix, Leonard?

00:07:02:657000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:02:657000.Dialogue: I do. And yet I'm doomed while you live on.

00:07:08:462000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:08:462000.Dialogue: Funny how things work out, isn't it?

00:07:10:682000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:10:682000.Dialogue: Oh, Lord, I think it's about to burst!

00:07:17:372000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:17:372000.Dialogue: On the other hand, it might have been the Brussels sprouts.

00:07:25:747000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:25:747000.Dialogue: Good night. (door closes) Appendicitis. What a nervous Nelly.

00:07:44:665000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:44:665000.Dialogue: Oh. And the Flash shirt is what? Because, what, you're gonna run really fast?

00:07:49:187000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:49:187000.Dialogue: No, the Flash shirt is because it's Friday, but it's nice when things work out. Where's your heart rate monitor?

00:07:58:279000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:58:279000.Dialogue: Do you have telematics in your shoes connected to an iPod?

00:08:00:815000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:00:815000.Dialogue: What do you do, you just go out there and gambol about like a bunny?

00:08:06:154000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:06:154000.Dialogue: No. I just run till I'm hungry, then I stop for a bear claw.

00:08:15:529000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:15:529000.Dialogue: It's good to stretch your muscles before you run.

00:08:33:714000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:33:714000.Dialogue: Oh. Wow. Good job. Okay, um, can you do this?

00:08:42:056000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:42:056000.Dialogue: Okay, let's just warm up on the run.

00:08:45:944000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:45:944000.Dialogue: I've been reading up on biomechanics. I think you'll be surprised at my...

00:08:52:217000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:52:217000.Dialogue: PENNY: Oh, my God, are you okay?

00:08:55:520000.Speaker: Penny.
00:08:55:520000.Dialogue: Oh, let me help you up.

00:09:02:627000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:02:627000.Dialogue: If it makes you feel any better, Thursday is no longer Cruciferous Vegetable Night.

00:09:09:350000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:09:350000.Dialogue: Here's my chicken curry. Howard, your shrimp biryani.

00:09:27:952000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:27:952000.Dialogue: Okay, can I get you after Friday when I get paid?

00:09:30:488000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:30:488000.Dialogue: What am I up to now?

00:09:32:240000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:32:240000.Dialogue: Well, okay, with the Indian food, the pizza, the Thai food, the tank of gas, the frozen yogurt and your rent, uh... a little over $1,400.

00:09:47:672000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:47:672000.Dialogue: He's just expressing his admiration that you don't even have to put out to get free stuff.

00:09:56:064000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:56:064000.Dialogue: It's not free-- I'm gonna pay him back. Shut up!

00:10:03:521000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:03:521000.Dialogue: Sheldon, are you gonna join us?

00:10:24:092000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:24:092000.Dialogue: Greetings, whatever the hell you are.

00:10:27:128000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:27:128000.Dialogue: I am a mobile virtual presence device. Recent events have demonstrated to me that my body is too fragile to endure the vicissitudes of the world. Until such time as I am able to transfer my consciousness, I shall remain in a secure location and interact with the world in this manner.

00:10:48:983000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:48:983000.Dialogue: Really? That's your question-- when did he put a ramp in?

00:11:11:680000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:11:680000.Dialogue: This may seem a little odd at first, but over time, you'll grow accustomed to dealing with me in this configuration.

00:11:20:839000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:20:839000.Dialogue: Yeah, to be honest, I don't see much difference.

00:11:23:775000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:23:775000.Dialogue: Thank you. That's what I was going for.

00:11:28:480000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:28:480000.Dialogue: Now, Leonard, tomorrow, when we go to work, you'll need to allow some extra time to get me down the stairs. For your convenience, I disassemble into four pieces.

00:11:40:292000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:40:292000.Dialogue: This is ridiculous. I'm coming to talk to you.

00:11:42:544000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:42:544000.Dialogue: (stammers) You don't know where I am.

00:11:46:247000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:46:247000.Dialogue: My physical body is safely ensconced in a secure, undisclosed location.

00:11:54:773000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:54:773000.Dialogue: I can hear your voice coming from your bedroom.

00:12:03:532000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:03:532000.Dialogue: Wait. Come back. Halt. Authorized personnel only!

00:12:11:940000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:11:940000.Dialogue: So, either one of you weirdos want to buy my underwear? Only 1,400 bucks.

00:12:22:801000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:22:801000.Dialogue: I'm behind you. Please look at me when you're talking to me.

00:12:29:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:29:090000.Dialogue: No, you're not. Pay no attention to that man in the bed.

00:12:32:844000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:32:844000.Dialogue: You cannot exist as a virtual presence. Not here and certainly not at work. Oh, good God.

00:12:39:634000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:39:634000.Dialogue: At my age, do you know how I'm statistically most likely to die?

00:12:44:055000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:44:055000.Dialogue: At the hands of your roommate?

00:12:47:909000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:47:909000.Dialogue: That's how I'm going to make it look.

00:12:50:378000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:50:378000.Dialogue: Until I can transfer my intellect to a more durable container, my body will remain safely ensconced in my bed.

00:12:57:085000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:57:085000.Dialogue: Fine, but don't expect my help.

00:12:59:137000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:59:137000.Dialogue: You have to help-- it's in the roommate agreement.

00:13:05:493000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:05:493000.Dialogue: Section 74.C. The various obligations and duties of the parties in the event one of them becomes a robot.

00:13:31:536000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:31:536000.Dialogue: It's much easier to enjoy the picturesque route we travel to work when you remove the specter of fiery vehicular death.

00:13:39:044000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:39:044000.Dialogue: Refresh my memory. Why didn't I just put you in the trunk?

00:13:52:206000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:52:206000.Dialogue: You seem tense. Perhaps this will relax you.

00:14:06:888000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:06:888000.Dialogue: I don't want to listen to music, Sheldon.

00:14:10:992000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:10:992000.Dialogue: Very well. I don't understand why you're not enjoying this. Together, in this car, with my enhanced capabilities, we're like Knight Rider.

00:14:23:288000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:23:288000.Dialogue: Except in Knight Rider, the car isn't ayammering sphincter.

00:14:28:242000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:28:242000.Dialogue: You mock the sphincter, but the sphincter is a class of muscle without which human beings couldn't survive.

00:14:38:386000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:38:386000.Dialogue: There are over 50 different sphincters in the human body. How many can you name?

00:14:45:760000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:45:760000.Dialogue: I was wrong-- this is exactly like Knight Rider.

00:14:49:731000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:49:731000.Dialogue: Perhaps you'd be interested in a different game.

00:14:53:201000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:53:201000.Dialogue: This is a photograph of the 1911 Solvay Conference on the theory of radiation and quanta. Using Photoshop, I've introduced a few anachronisms. See if you can spot all 24. I'll give you the first one. Madame Curie should not be wearing a digital watch. And go.

00:15:27:268000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:27:268000.Dialogue: And I'm safe and sound in bed. Who's crazy now?

00:15:31:940000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:31:940000.Dialogue: I'm still going to go with you.

00:15:40:498000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:40:498000.Dialogue: Hello, Professor Hoskins. Nice to see you, Mindy. And konnichiwa, Dr. Nakamora. Sorry the Swedes disproved your theory.

00:16:02:087000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:02:087000.Dialogue: Be a lamb and open it for me.

00:16:12:747000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:12:747000.Dialogue: You think you have me stymied, don't you?

00:16:15:683000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:15:683000.Dialogue: No, I think a doorknob has you stymied.

00:16:20:655000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:20:655000.Dialogue: Oh, look, it's Leonard and R2-D-Bag.

00:16:25:493000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:25:493000.Dialogue: That's my joke. I told it last night. You can't just use it.

00:16:29:497000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:29:497000.Dialogue: Raj, be a lamb and open the door for me.

00:16:47:882000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:47:882000.Dialogue: Isn't this nice? The pleasures of fellowship and camaraderie without having to tolerate your germy breath on my skin.

00:16:57:192000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:57:192000.Dialogue: I say we just take him to Tatooine and sell him to some Jawas.

00:17:01:246000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:01:246000.Dialogue: That's two, dude. Write your own jokes.

00:17:05:867000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:05:867000.Dialogue: Oh, great. Hi, I'm Penny, I'll be your waitress.

00:17:13:091000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:13:091000.Dialogue: I'd rather people not know I have any prior connection to you whatsoever.

00:17:17:679000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:17:679000.Dialogue: Can you tell me the specials this evening?

00:17:19:964000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:19:964000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm not waiting on you.

00:17:21:466000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:21:466000.Dialogue: Obviously. I don't even have water yet.

00:17:26:221000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:26:221000.Dialogue: That's discrimination against the otherwise located.

00:17:30:758000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:30:758000.Dialogue: I'm going to have to go over your head.

00:17:34:779000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:34:779000.Dialogue: Manager... manager. Oh, Lord, look who it is.

00:17:49:794000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:49:794000.Dialogue: Penny, Steve Wozniak was one of the cofounders of Apple Computer. He and Steve Jobs started it...

00:17:52:997000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:52:997000.Dialogue: Yeah, I know who he is. I watch Dancing with the Stars.

00:18:03:558000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:03:558000.Dialogue: You know, there's an Olive Garden down the street. You guys should try it sometime.

00:18:11:299000.Speaker: Steve Wozniak
00:18:11:299000.Dialogue: Oh, hey. Nice virtual presence device.

00:18:14:369000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:14:369000.Dialogue: Thank you. I just want to say I'm a big fan. You're my 15th favorite technological visionary.

00:18:23:494000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:23:494000.Dialogue: It's still six spots above Steve Jobs.

00:18:28:016000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:28:016000.Dialogue: I care neither for turtlenecks nor showmanship.

00:18:31:319000.Speaker: Steve Wozniak
00:18:31:319000.Dialogue: Yeah, I never got that turtleneck thing.

00:18:34:689000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:34:689000.Dialogue: One of my proudest possessions is a vintage 1977 Apple Two. Despite the file system limitations of Apple DOS 3.3, it was a pretty nifty little achievement.

00:18:48:536000.Speaker: Steve Wozniak
00:18:48:536000.Dialogue: You know, if you had it here, I'd autograph it for you.

00:18:52:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:52:040000.Dialogue: Don't move for 15 to 30 minutes, depending on how the buses are running.

00:18:58:930000.Scene: The hallway. Sheldon approaches Penny’s door and starts bashing into it.
00:18:58:930000.Speaker: Steve Wozniak

00:19:04:485000.Scene: The hallway. Sheldon approaches Penny’s door and starts bashing into it.
00:19:04:485000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:04:485000.Dialogue: I'm coming, Woz, I'm coming. (gasps) Ow! (clattering) Oh! Aw.

00:19:24:840000.Scene: The hallway. Sheldon approaches Penny’s door and starts bashing into it.
00:19:24:840000.Speaker: Sheldon
